file_content.text: Hello again. I hope Coruscant is treating you better than it has treated us.
You're back! Did you find Ria? What happened?
Your mate's no longer on Coruscant.
She's gone.
What? No, this can't be! Where did she go?
I can't say.
Oh my poor Ria! She was my most valued possession. Why do the ancestors punish me so?
She wanted to end the relationship, so she went away. That's all I can tell you.
She left you.
I don't know and I don't care.
Not my problem.
She doesn't want to see you anymore, Nik.
She's leaving you.
What are you saying? This can't be! Someone must be coercing her!
No one's coercing her. She made her choice, and you have to accept that.
This is what she wants.
My Ria, my beautiful beloved... why do the ancestors punish me so?
Perhaps.
My poor Ria. Someday I'll find a way to get her back... but you've already done more than I could have expected.
I don't care why she did what she did.
Not my problem.
Fine. You've done enough.
Ria was killed in a freak garbage compactor accident.
She's dead.
What? No, it can't be! My poor Ria... my most valued possession! Why do the ancestors punish me so?
I suppose we should settle up, despite the fact that you failed to bring my beloved back. This is yours.
I wish it had worked out.
I must take heart. At least you tried. Thank you and farewell.
You're a terrible person.
It's good to see someone still cares. May the ancestors watch over you.
Next time, be a man. Go after your women yourself.
I'm not helping you again.
We all have our talents. Mine are in the arena of commerce. This is for your trouble. So long.
There you are! Ria is back home--thank the ancestors.
As for any unpleasantness... Ria's clearly confused and has been unduly influenced by the guild.
Just glad you two worked everything out.
I'm pleased you're together.
Indeed. Every relationship has its ups and downs. Keeps things interesting.
You'd better keep a closer eye on her.
Don't lose her again.
I intend to send Ria back to my family on the homeworld. Coruscant is not safe for someone so beautiful and... easily confused.
I'm on a schedule, Nik. If you could just pay what you owe me....
Now for my money.
Yes, of course. You've given me something more precious than anything in the galaxy, and you deserve a handsome reward.
I hope that this will help express my deepest gratitude. I am forever in your debt.
Glad I could help.
Pleasure doing business.
It's good to see someone still cares. Farewell.
Forever's a long time. But I guess it's a big debt.
Remember that.
I hope Coruscant treats you better than it has treated us. So long.
Have you spoken to Ria? I can't bear the thought of her forced to dance for those rogues!
I'm desperate, Mal!
I wish I could help, Nik, I really do, but I can't spare the manpower.
Is this what the Republic has been reduced to? Indifference to the suffering of aliens?
My species hasn't affected the way I've been treated.
I'm an alien, and I'm fine.
Maybe that's because you're human enough. Or rich enough, or special enough.
Indifference is not the policy of the Jedi.
That's not our way.
Then why defend an organization that ignores its alien citizens? Look around. Do we look happy here?
Why is it that you suffer?
What is the problem?
Because we have the apparent misfortune of not being human.
The Republic serves its citizens, sir, and serves them well.
That's not how it is.
They serve some better than others--especially if you only have two ears and two eyes.
Rely on a good blaster, not bureaucrats.
Never count on the government.
That's easy for a hardened mercenary to say. But we are peaceful merchants. It is apparently also our misfortune to be aliens.
Huh?
You want to know? This is about the gross neglect of the aliens in the old Galactic Market.
The Republic isn't fond of non-human species.
Life as an alien is tough.
You're very right. But at least you're in a position to do something about it.
Does whining about it make you feel better?
Aren't you obnoxious?
You call protesting the neglect of peaceful Republic citizens whining?
For us, there is no justice. We are ruled over by gangsters who call themselves the Migrant Merchants' Guild! While Republic security--
Nik, none of you should be living here. We can't guarantee your safety. You know that.
Our homes were buried under rubble during the war! Not our fault the businessmen here are all crooks.
Maybe I can assist.
I don't know. Things are not well at all, and I do so need someone.
I understand things are difficult, but getting excited won't help.
Please calm down.
Excited? This isn't some minor inconvenience.
Is everyone living here so sensitive, or is it just you?
This is pathetic.
I'm sorry if my pain causes you discomfort, but the situation is intolerable!
The Republic considers us squatters and wants us out! The Migrant Merchants' Guild claims to protect us, but all they do is exploit us!
Now the guild has kidnapped my mate Ria and put her to work as an entertainer. Ria! Forced to dance for the pleasure of scoundrels!
Why did the guild kidnap your mate?
Was there a reason for this?
Because I failed to make my "protection" payments. And as you can see, Republic security couldn't care less.
You should've mentioned that earlier. Is kidnapping common?
That is serious.
The guild does whatever it wishes. They are worse than Hutts! Given Republic security's apathy, what is an honest merchant to do?
Oh for goodness sake, Nik! Give it a rest!
You lost your mate? Big deal. Get another one.
So find another girl.
This is not some droid I speak of! This is my beautiful partner!
There's no telling what humiliations and depravities Ria's been forced to endure. My beloved is worth a great deal to me. Bring her back and I'll reward you handsomely!
All right.
All right, I'll do it. I always was a sucker for people in love....
Okay, she is your mate....
Thank the ancestors! I cannot express what this means to me!
Ria is being held with the other dancers in the guild headquarters. She's a beautiful Nautolan with lovely green head-tresses--I'm sure you'll know her.
Not worth it. [Refuse quest]
Such heartlessness--our future is grim indeed....
Please don't talk to me right now.
